instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged - fan spin, no chime
threads.message:
board was liquid damaged near the SMC area and ISL area.
before i get no fan spin, no green light.
after a SMC reflowed and replaced the ISL then i get fan spin and a green light and charging light.

CPU does get warm. but no chime. no beeps when i removed the RAM. but i do get 1 beep after approx 20sec later.
USB mouse doesnt light up.

Sleep light stays on solid, doesn't pulse.


<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.55v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMP</SIGNAL>... = 12.55v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.46v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.78v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.43v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> = 3.296
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 1.118v
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 3.306v

<CHIP>U2600</CHIP>'s All clock frequency is messed up. pulsing between 11.MHZ to 12k.MHZ

i've already tried another BIOS chip but still no go.


do i have a dead SMC?


ok i've replaced <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>, all frequency is now 25k.Mhz except pin3's frequency is pulsing from 25k.MHZ to 29k.MKZ

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged - fan spin, no chime
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged - fan spin, no chime
threads.message:
no beeps after i removed the memory. but i do get 1 beep after approx 20sec.

so its brain dead at the moment.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged - fan spin, no chime
threads.message: Board damage in the ISL area under the layers. It also happens when thunderbolt area blows up in that reason. Most likely trash.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - liquid damaged - fan spin, no chime
threads.message: got it to chrime after replacing the SMC. I will check rest of the board and will report back.
